reviews.text: Location: 1)can catch ski shuttle bus - one block away 2)can walk to town
reviews.title: good location AND value for your money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food: good breakfast & nice apres ski w/fresh fruit at front desk
reviews.title: Great Find!!!

reviews.text: Room: very spacious/ beds were okay, could be better /shower had intermittent hot & cold water/heat came on/off all night but you get used to it
reviews.title: Aspen Mountain Lodge--A Bit Dated

reviews.text: Atmosphere: garden level did mean there was more noise, but again, not too bad/video library/free wi-fi in room/ free internet station/nice hot tub /nice staff
reviews.title: Perfect Stay, Perfect Location

reviews.text: I chose this hotel due to the price and was not disappointed. It is only a short walk to downtown Aspen and the bus stops near the hotel for access to the skiing.
reviews.title: Great Service, No Frills Accommodation

reviews.text: The staff were great, the rooms were clean and spacious, however, mine was a little bit on the dark side.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are most certainly nicer hotels in Aspen, but I would definitely reccommend the Aspen Mountain Lodge as a good quality budget option.
reviews.title: Good accomodations at a reasonable price

reviews.text: Very satisifed with my 4 night stay at the Aspen Mountain Lodge. Within easy walking distance to downtown, buses and the gondola. Room was large and spacious. The staff was very pleasant and I enjoyed a cup of tea every afternoon in front of the fireplace.
reviews.title: Great Value in an Expensive Town
Nice and homey
reviews.text: Aspen is an expensive town, so it was good to find an affordable place to stay. We had a room with a balcony on an upper floor and it was very spacious and clean. The bed was comfortable. it is a homey sort of place with a nice lounge on the lower ground floor. the breakfast was marginal, but that is almost to be expected. i would go back.

reviews.title: What a find!
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed on a weekend getaway and it was perfect. It is in easy walking distance of the downtown area and great restaurants. The rooms were cozy, clean and nice. The best part is the central lodge with a huge stone fireplace, comfy leather couches and lots of books and boardgames for the guests to use. There was a good continental breakfast included too. We will be returning when we go ski!

reviews.title: Best place we've ever stayed!
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel last weekend, and I was so impressed! It is not only beautiful, but they seem to have anticipated our every need. We brought our 2 little dogs, and they were very welcoming to them and even gave them water bowls and chew toys! The room was lovely and the sitting areas with the fireplace (right outside the room) was delightful. The service was great and the hotel is within walking distance of downtown. We'll never stay anywhere else in Aspen except this lovely place!

reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay!
reviews.text: The atmosphere was cozy and clean. The breakfast was great. We ran the Golden Leaf Half-Marathon and the staff was kind and let us have late checkout. We plan to stay here again next year.

reviews.title: Nice place, great location.
reviews.text: We booked a long weekend stay at short notice for early August. Admittedly, our choice of selections was quite limited due to the short notice for our travel. We have to say it was a pleasant hotel stay for us. We enjoyed the ambiance and found the Aspen Mountain Lodge to be just right. Friendly service, nicely appointed, clean rooms and a great location a very short walk from the center of town.

reviews.title: Great Value In Aspen
reviews.text: When we asked for directions to Pine Creek Cookhouse, the staff not only gave them to us. But called to confirm our reservations that we made prior to arriving in town.
